7.
Comolia ovalifolia (DC.) Triana (1872: 37
, tab. 2, fig. 27d). ≡
Tricentrum ovalifolium De Candolle (1828: 123)
.

=
Arthrostemma rotundifolium Naudin
, nom. nud. , mss.

subSubSection.paragraph:
=
Comolia ovalifolia O.Berg.
, nom. nud ., mss.

=
Rhexia psammophila Mart.
, nom. nud ., mss.

Notes:—
Tricentrum ovalifolium
has as its original material
Pr. de Neuwied s.n.
deposited at herbarium Kunth (currently B ) ( De Candolle 1828 ), but was destroyed during World War II , only leaving an F negative ( F 0 BN016843 ). A duplicate of this collection was found at BR ( BR0000008930897 , Figure 5 ) and a fragment of the type at G ( G00310227 ; specifically at G-DC). Therefore, this name needs to be lectotypified (see Article 9.3 of the ICN ). The duplicate at BR is designated here as the lectotype , according to Article 9.11 of the ICN . In this material, the nomina nuda “
Comolia ovalifolia O.Berg.
” and “
Rhexia psammophila Mart.
” were found ( Figure 5 )
.

Comolia denudata
was described from Sellow s.n. at P (P05287597), so it did not need to be typified. However, when Naudin (1850a) established
C. denudata
, he synonymized
T. ovalifolium
under it and did not prioritize the epithet “
ovalifolium
”, according to Article 11.3 of the ICN, thus
C. denudata
is considered a superfluous and illegitimate name.

Tetrameris rotundifolia
was described from two collections deposited at P:
Martius Herb. Fl. Bras. n. 419
and
Blanchet 1688
( Naudin 1850). In this way, both collections are considered syntypes (see Article 9.6 of the ICN )
.
Here ,
Blanchet 1688
( P00481581 ) is designated as lectotype , according to Article 9.12 of the ICN
,
and the duplicates ( P00481582 and P00481583 ) are the isolectotypes. The nomen nudum “
Arthrostemma rotundifolium Naudin
” was found in the remaining syntype
Martius Herb. Fl. Bras. n. 419
( P00481580 )
.

In Flora brasiliensis , Cogniaux (1885) described three varieties of
Comolia ovalifolia
:
var. blanchetiana Cogn.
,
var. acutifolia Cogn.
, and
var. denudata Cogn. Among
these varieties,
C. ovalifolia var. blanchetiana
needs to be neotypified (see Articles 9.8 and 9.13 of the ICN), because Blanchet 1688 part. , indicated by Cogniaux (1885) as the original material of this variety, was not found in the herbaria consulted. Thus, we chose Blanchet 1689 at G (G00319188; specifically at G-DC), as it was collected by the same collector, had a collection number close to Blanchet 1688 part. , and was collected in the same region of the original material analyzed by Cogniaux (1885) . The other two varieties have duplicates distributed by some herbaria and Cogniaux (1885) did not indicate a duplicate as a type. Thus, according to Article 9.3 of the ICN, these names need to be typified. According to Article 9.11, the lectotypes are designated here: for
C. ovalifolia var. acutifolia
the duplicate at K (K000530815) was chosen, while for
C. ovalifolia var. denudata
the duplicate at G (G00319055; specifically at G-DC) was chosen. Besides, after analyzing the original materials of
C. ovalifolia var. blanchetiana
and
C. ovalifolia var. denudata
, we suggest that these two varieties should be considered synonyms under
C. ovalifolia
, considering that the species has a variation in leaf morphology ( Seco 2006 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5. Photograph of the lectotype of
Comolia ovalifolia (DC.) Triana
at BR. Source: ©National Botanic Garden of Belgium, Meise Botanic Garden, Meise, BR0000008930897. Available in: http://www.botanicalcollections.be/specimen/BR0000008930897.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Finally, it is worth mentioning that Martius Herb. Fl. Bras. n. 499 , cataloged in Herbarium Florae brasiliensis as “
Arthrostemma villosum DC.
” ( Martius 1841 ), is
C. ovalifolia
. Labels with this determination can be found in duplicates at BR (BR0000005738984 and BR0000005739318), G (G00318931), and K (K000530816). This collection was considered “
Arthrostemma villosum Mart.
” by Cogniaux (1885) and synonymized by him under
C. ovalifolia
. “
Arthrostemma villosum Mart.
” is treated here as a nomen nudum because it disagrees with Article 38.1 of the ICN.
